trans-unit.source: Managed Namespaces
trans-unit.target: Managed Namespaces

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Managed Namespaces
trans-unit.target: Managed Namespaces

trans-unit.source: A <newTerm>managed namespace</newTerm> is an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> that is partially managed by another service.
trans-unit.target: A <newTerm>managed namespace</newTerm> is an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> that is partially managed by another service.

trans-unit.source: These <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s are similar to standard <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s, except that their managed settings cannot be viewed or edited, and you cannot use an application-specific certificate to sign tokens for a relying party application.
trans-unit.target: These <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s are similar to standard <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s, except that their managed settings cannot be viewed or edited, and you cannot use an application-specific certificate to sign tokens for a relying party application.

trans-unit.source: Examples of Managed Namespaces
trans-unit.target: Examples of Managed Namespaces

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Azure Service Bus</embeddedLabel> uses a dedicated <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> to control access to the Service Bus service.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Azure Service Bus</embeddedLabel> uses a dedicated <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> to control access to the Service Bus service.

trans-unit.source: These namespaces are characterized by a "-sb" in the namespace name.
trans-unit.target: These namespaces are characterized by a "-sb" in the namespace name.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Azure Cache</embeddedLabel> uses a dedicated <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> to control access to the Cache service.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Azure Cache</embeddedLabel> uses a dedicated <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> to control access to the Cache service.

trans-unit.source: These namespaces are characterized by a "-cache" in the namespace name.
trans-unit.target: These namespaces are characterized by a "-cache" in the namespace name.

trans-unit.source: Managed Settings
trans-unit.target: Managed Settings

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Token-Signing Certificates and Keys</embeddedLabel>—Token-signing certificates and keys for the namespace are managed automatically.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Token-Signing Certificates and Keys</embeddedLabel>—Token-signing certificates and keys for the namespace are managed automatically.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, these certificates and keys are hidden and users cannot add new token-signing certificates or keys at the namespace level.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, these certificates and keys are hidden and users cannot add new token-signing certificates or keys at the namespace level.

trans-unit.source: In the management service, clients are not able to read or write to the ServiceKeys table.
trans-unit.target: In the management service, clients are not able to read or write to the ServiceKeys table.

trans-unit.source: Token-decryption certificates are automatically managed.
trans-unit.target: Token-decryption certificates are automatically managed.

trans-unit.source: In the ACS Management Portal, these certificates are hidden and users cannot add new token-decryption certificates.
trans-unit.target: In the ACS Management Portal, these certificates are hidden and users cannot add new token-decryption certificates.

trans-unit.source: When you add a new relying party application to a managed namespace, the certificated and key process depends on the type of relying party that you are adding:
trans-unit.target: When you add a new relying party application to a managed namespace, the certificated and key process depends on the type of relying party that you are adding:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft-managed relying party applications in a managed namespace, such as a Service Bus relying party in a Service Bus namespace or a cache namespace, must use the certificates and keys for the namespace.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft-managed relying party applications in a managed namespace, such as a Service Bus relying party in a Service Bus namespace or a cache namespace, must use the certificates and keys for the namespace.

trans-unit.source: If the tokens that are issued to Microsoft-managed relying party applications in managed namespaces are signed with an application-specific (dedicated) certificate or key, authentication does not work properly.
trans-unit.target: If the tokens that are issued to Microsoft-managed relying party applications in managed namespaces are signed with an application-specific (dedicated) certificate or key, authentication does not work properly.

trans-unit.source: When you add a Microsoft-managed relying party application to a managed namespace, such as a Service Bus relying party in a Service Bus namespace, select the <ui>Use service namespace certificate (standard)</ui> option that directs ACS to use the certificate for all applications in the managed namespace.
trans-unit.target: When you add a Microsoft-managed relying party application to a managed namespace, such as a Service Bus relying party in a Service Bus namespace, select the <ui>Use service namespace certificate (standard)</ui> option that directs ACS to use the certificate for all applications in the managed namespace.

trans-unit.source: On the Certificates and Keys, page, do not select <ui>Add Token Signing Certificate</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the Certificates and Keys, page, do not select <ui>Add Token Signing Certificate</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If you are required to enter a certificate or key, such as when using SWT protocol, enter the required information, and then, after saving, return to the page and delete the application-specific certificate or key.
trans-unit.target: If you are required to enter a certificate or key, such as when using SWT protocol, enter the required information, and then, after saving, return to the page and delete the application-specific certificate or key.

trans-unit.source: When you add a custom relying party application that you manage, select the <ui>Use a dedicated certificate</ui> option to create an application-specific certificate or key .
trans-unit.target: When you add a custom relying party application that you manage, select the <ui>Use a dedicated certificate</ui> option to create an application-specific certificate or key .

trans-unit.source: Do not rely on the ACS-managed certificates and keys that are configured for the entire namespace.
trans-unit.target: Do not rely on the ACS-managed certificates and keys that are configured for the entire namespace.

trans-unit.source: If you do, the certificates and keys expire, typically within a year, and you cannot renew them.
trans-unit.target: If you do, the certificates and keys expire, typically within a year, and you cannot renew them.

trans-unit.source: Managed namespaces are not intended to be used for custom solutions.
trans-unit.target: Managed namespaces are not intended to be used for custom solutions.

trans-unit.source: Instead, use standard Access Control namespaces.
trans-unit.target: Instead, use standard Access Control namespaces.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Decryption Certificates</embeddedLabel>—Token-decryption certificates are automatically managed.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Decryption Certificates</embeddedLabel>—Token-decryption certificates are automatically managed.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, these certificates are hidden and users cannot add new token-decryption certificates.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, these certificates are hidden and users cannot add new token-decryption certificates.

trans-unit.source: In the management service, clients are not able to read or write to the ServiceKeys table.
trans-unit.target: In the management service, clients are not able to read or write to the ServiceKeys table.

trans-unit.source: Managed namespaces are not intended to be used for custom solutions, as are regular <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s.
trans-unit.target: Managed namespaces are not intended to be used for custom solutions, as are regular <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>s.
